reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 161/05: TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT IN DEFINED INDUSTRIES - PRODUCTION OF RECORDED VISUAL OR AUDIO-VISUAL ENTERTAINMENT
reg_info.reg_name_text: TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT IN DEFINED INDUSTRIES — PRODUCTION OF RECORDED VISUAL OR AUDIO-VISUAL ENTERTAINMENT
reg_info.citation: O. Reg. 161/05: TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT IN DEFINED INDUSTRIES - PRODUCTION OF RECORDED VISUAL OR AUDIO-VISUAL ENTERTAINMENT

content.content: 1. (1) In this Regulation, “defined industry” means, subject to subsection (2), the industry of producing visual or audio-visual recorded entertainment that is intended to be replayed in cinemas or on the Internet, as part of a television broadcast, or on a VCR or DVD player or a similar device. O. Reg. 161/05, s. 1 (1). (2) The producing of commercials (other than trailers), video games or recorded visual or audio-visual educational material is not part of the defined industry. O. Reg. 161/05, s. 1 (2).
content.raw_html:
1. (1) In this Regulation,

“defined industry” means, subject to subsection (2), the industry of producing visual or audio-visual recorded entertainment that is intended to be replayed in cinemas or on the Internet, as part of a television broadcast, or on a VCR or DVD player or a similar device. O. Reg. 161/05, s. 1 (1).

(2) The producing of commercials (other than trailers), video games or recorded visual or audio-visual educational material is not part of the defined industry. O. Reg. 161/05, s. 1 (2).

content.content: 2. This Regulation sets out terms and conditions of employment that apply to employers and employees in the defined industry. O. Reg. 161/05, s. 2.
content.raw_html: 2. This Regulation sets out terms and conditions of employment that apply to employers and employees in the defined industry. O. Reg. 161/05, s. 2.

content.content: 3. (1) If the employer and the employee agree, subsection (2) applies instead of subsection 18 (1) of the Act. O. Reg. 161/05, s. 3 (1). (2) An employer shall give an employee a period of at least eight consecutive hours free from performing work in each day. O. Reg. 161/05, s. 3 (2). Français

3. (1) If the employer and the employee agree, subsection (2) applies instead of subsection 18 (1) of the Act. O. Reg. 161/05, s. 3 (1).

(2) An employer shall give an employee a period of at least eight consecutive hours free from performing work in each day. O. Reg. 161/05, s. 3 (2).
